sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with singular matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using the inverse matrix method:

x + 2y + 3z = 7  
2x - 3y + 4z = -1  
3x + 4y + 7z = 11

The matrix [A] = [1 2 3; 2 -3 4; 3 4 7] is singular, i.e., it has no inverse.
message_2: Since the matrix A is singular and has no inverse, we cannot use the inverse matrix method to solve this system of linear equations. Instead, we can use other methods such as Gaussian elimination, Cramer's rule, or substitution to solve the system.
